org.antlr.intellij.adaptor.lexer

Class AntlrLexerAdapter<State extends AntlrLexerState>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.lexer.Lexer
      • com.intellij.lexer.LexerBase
        • org.antlr.intellij.adaptor.lexer.AntlrLexerAdapter<State>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleAntlrAdapter

    public abstract class AntlrLexerAdapter<State extends AntlrLexerState>
extends com.intellij.lexer.LexerBase
    This is the base class for implementations of Lexer backed by an ANTLR 4 lexer.

    For lexers which do not store custom state information, the default implementation SimpleAntlrAdapter can be used.

      • applyLexerState

        protected void applyLexerState(org.antlr.v4.runtime.CharStream input,
                               State state)
        Update the current lexer to use the specified input stream starting in the specified state.

        The current lexer may be obtained by calling getLexer(). The default implementation calls Lexer.setInputStream(org.antlr.v4.runtime.IntStream) to set the input stream, followed by AntlrLexerState.apply(org.antlr.v4.runtime.Lexer) to initialize the state of the lexer.

        Parameters:
        input - The new input stream for the lexer.
        state - A State instance containing the starting state for the lexer.

      • getInitialState

        protected abstract State getInitialState()
        Get the initial State of the lexer.
        Returns:
        a State instance representing the state of the lexer at the beginning of an input.

      • getLexerState

        protected abstract State getLexerState(org.antlr.v4.runtime.Lexer lexer)
        Get a State instance representing the current state of the specified lexer.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A State instance containing the current state of the lexer.

      • toLexerState

        protected State toLexerState(int state)
        Gets the State corresponding to the specified IntelliJ state.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The State instance corresponding to the specified state.
